info.title: Deveel OCM API
info.description: Specifications of the Deveel Omni-Channel Messaging API v1

400.description: Some of the contents of the channel were invalid

405.description: The provider does not allow some of the functions of the channel

409.description: A channel with the same name already exists

415.description: One of the content types of the channel is not supported by the provider

200.description: The list of channels of the current user
The channel with the given ID is returned

404.description: No channel with the given ID was found

200.description: The channel with the given name is returned

404.description: No channel with the given name was found

200.description: The page of channels of the current user

400.description: One or more of the parameters is invalid
The request contained some invalid elements

404.description: The channel was not found

204.description: A channel with the given name exists

400.description: The name of the channel is invalid

404.description: None channel with the given name was found

200.description: The request was found and returned

404.description: No channel assignment request with the given identifier was found

post.summary: Requests the Assignment of a Channel

400.description: The content of the request is wrong

404.description: The channel requested was not found

409.description: A channel with the same name already exists

415.description: The content type of the channel is not allowed

200.description: The number was found and returned

404.description: None e-mail with the given ID was found

200.description: The number was found and returned

404.description: None number with the given ID was not found

get.summary: Gets a page of Phone Numbers

404.description: The source terminal from the inventory was not found

409.description: A terminal with the same address already exists

200.description: The terminals page was found and returned
The terminal was found and returned

404.description: The terminal was not found

200.description: The terminal was found and returned

400.description: The content of the request is invalid

404.description: The terminal was not found

post.summary: Creates a new Route of Incoming Messages

404.description: The channel was not found

405.description: The channel does not support inbound messaging

get.summary: Gets a Route of Incoming Messages

200.description: The route with the given ID was found

404.description: No route was found with the given ID
None route was found with the given ID

patch.summary: Updates the information of a Message Route

200.description: The updated version of the route

204.description: The update request did not cause any changes

304.description: No changes were made to the route

404.description: None route was found with the given ID

put.summary: Updates the Status of a Message Route

200.description: The updated version of the route

304.description: The update request did not cause any changes

404.description: None route was found with the given ID

get.summary: Gets a page of Message Routes

400.description: The contents of the request is invalid

404.description: The channel was not found

get.summary: Gets a page of Message State Subscriptions

400.description: The page number or size are invalid

get.summary: Gets a Subscription to Messages States

404.description: The subscription was not found
None subscription with the given ID was found
The subscription was not found

scopes.update:channel: Update settings of existing user Channels
scopes.request:terminal: Request the assignment of existing or new terminals
scopes.send:message: Configure notifications of message state changes

scopes.update:channel: Update settings of existing user Channels
scopes.request:terminal: Request the assignment of existing or new terminals
scopes.send:message: Configure notifications of message state changes

limit.description: The provisioned upper limit of the quota

ChannelQuota.description: A provisioned usage quota of a channel capability

MessageContentType.description: Enumerates the possible types of contents in a message

keyName.description: The name of the key (eg. the name of the header)

ApiKeyCredentials.description: The specification of an API Key used to secure a channel

userName.description: The name of the user of the credentials

password.description: The secret password of the credentials

BasicAuthCredentials.description:
The specification of a Basic authentication used to
secure the connection of a channel

name.description: The unique name of the credentials set

SecureChannelCredentials.description:
Specifies secure credentials for the authentication
of channels towards providers

id.description: The unique identifier of the terminal instance

ChannelTerminal.description:
A server terminal that is bound to a specific
channel instance

quotas.description: The usage quotas to be enforced within the channel

name.description: The name of the channel instance

contentTypes.description: The list of allowed types of message content

senderTypes.description:
The types of terminals allowed by the channel to
send messages outbound

receiverTypes.description:
The types of terminals allowed by the channel to
receive messages inbound

credentials.description:
The credentials that will be used to access the
provider of messaging services

terminals.description: A list of terminals to be bound to the channel

lastChanged.description:
The exact time-stamp of the last change to the
settings and states of the channel

name.description: The name of the channel instance

tenantId.description: The identifier of the tenant of the cannel

provider.description:
The provider of messaging services used by
the channel instance

settings.description:
A collection of settings of the channel instance (Note: the
types of settings depend on the type of channel)

id.description: The unique identifier of the channel instance

contentTypes.description:
A list of message content types that are supported
by the channel (either because of configuration or because
of native capabilities of the channel)

quotas.description:
A list of provisioned messaging quotas (limits)
to the usage of the channel instance

senderTypes.description: The types of terminal allowed by the channel to send messages outbound

receiverTypes.description: The types of terminal allowed by the channel to receive messages inbound

terminals.description:
A list of server terminals associated with the channel, that
can send or receive messages (accordingly to their assigned role)

UserChannel.description: The instance of a channel owned by a customer

name.description: The name of the channel instance

senderTypes.description:
The types of terminals allowed to send messages outbound (if not
set the channel will inherit all the allowed types from the
source channel)

receiverTypes.description:
The types of terminals allowed to receive messages inbound
(if not set the channel will inherit all the allowed types from 
the source channel)

settings.description:
The settings specific for the channel instance, integrating
or overriding the settings from the source channel

terminals.description: The list of terminals to be bound to the channel

sourceId.description: The identifier of the source channel from the inventory

quotas.description: The usage quotas assigned to the channel

NewChannelAssignmentRequest.description: A new assignment request of a channel from the inventory

timeStamp.description: The exact time-stamp of the response

AssignmentResponse.description: The response to the request of assignment of a resources

requester.description: The identifier of the user that made the request

timeStamp.description: The exact time-stamp of the request

id.description: The unique identifier of the request

ChannelAssignmentRequest.description: The request of assignment of a channel from the inventory

address.description: The address part of the e-mail

displayName.description: An optional name displayed to the receivers

EmailAddress.description: Represents a full e-mail address terminal

emailAddress.description: The email address of the terminal

number.description: The telephone number (MSISDN) of the terminal

emailAddress.description: The email address of the terminal

number.description: The telephone number (MSISDN) of the terminal

Terminal.description: A terminal allows to send or receive messages through channels

channel.description: The name of the channel transporting the inbound messages

name.description: A descriptive name of the route (for display)

retryCount.description:
The number of attempts to perform when trying to
deliver an inbound message, before failing

destinationUrl.description: The URL where to deliver the inbound messages

secret.description: An optional secret string used to sign the webhook

filters.description:
An optional set of additional filters used to retrict the messages 
to be routed to the destination

headers.description:
An optional set of headers attached to the delivery
request (used for correlation)

NewMessageRoute.description: The request to create a new route to receive inbound messages

name.description: The name of the channel instance

id.description: The unique identifier of the channel

RouteChannel.description:
Describes a channel that receives and routes
inbound messages

destinationUrl.description: The URL where to deliver the inbound messages

secret.description: An optional secret string used to sign the webhook

filters.description:
An optional set of additional filters used to retrict the messages 
to be routed to the destination

headers.description:
An optional set of headers attached to the delivery
request (used for correlation)

id.description: The unique identifier of the route

name.description: The descriptive name of the route

active.description: Indicates the active state of a route

retryCount.description:
The number of attempts to perform when trying to
deliver an inbound message, before failing

MessageRoute.description: Specifies the rules to route inbound messages (delivered as webhooks)

fields.description: Indicates which fields have to be updated with the request

destinationUrl.description: The URL where to deliver the inbound messages

secret.description: An optional secret string used to sign the webhook

filters.description:
An optional set of additional filters used to retrict the messages 
to be routed to the destination

headers.description:
An optional set of headers attached to the delivery
request (used for correlation)

MessageRouteUpdate.description: A request to update the configurations of a message route

active.description: Wether or not the message route should be active or not

MessageRouteStatusUpdate.description: The request to change the status of a message route

name.description: A descriptive custom name of the subscription

destinationUrl.description: The URL where the webhooks should be delivered

secret.description: An optional secret word that is used to sign the webhooks to secure them

headers.description:
A set of optional headers that are attached to the webhook
request (for correlation)

events.description: The type of message event to subscribe

filters.description: An optional set of filters that restrict the events to be notified

retryCount.description:
The number of attempts to perform when trying to deliver
the webhook, before failing

WebhookSubscriptionRequests.description:
Requests the subscription to the notification of event
occurrences within the system

destinationUrl.description:
The HTTP URL address where the notifications
are delivered (as webhooks)

secret.description:
An optional secret string used to sign the webhooks
delivered to the subscriber

headers.description:
A set of additional headers attached to the HTTP request
fired towards the destination URL (typically used for context)

id.description: The unique identider of the subscription

events.description: The list of message event types subscribed

name.description: A descriptive name of the subscription (for display)

active.description: The active state of the subscription

retryCount.description:
The number of attempts to perform when trying to deliver
the webhook, before failing

filters.description:
An optional set of filters used to restrict the
delivery of webhooks

WebhookSubscription.description: The subscription to the notification of an event

active.description: Wether or not the subscription should be active

WebhookSubscriptionStatusUpdate.description: A request to change the active status of a subscription
